stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Silence
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] None
[Place of Birth] Columbia
[Date of Birth] May 18
[Race] Liberi
[Height] 154cm
[Infection Status] 
Crystals have appeared on her body. Infection confirmed by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Normal 
[Mobility] Normal 
[Physical Resilience] Normal 
[Tactical Acumen] Standard 
[Combat Skill] Standard 
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Excellent

Silence was an Originium researcher at Rhine Lab, LLC. She was involved in several unknown applied research projects as well as several clinical trials on Oripathy.
She now provides battlefield medical treatments to Rhodes Island.

Imaging tests have shown the outlines of her internal organs to be indistinct due to abnormal shadows. Originium granules have been detected in her circulatory system, confirming her to be infected with Oripathy.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 6% 
Patient has ore lesion located on the upper left thigh. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.24u/L
Patient does not exhibit high Blood Originium-Crystal Density. Infection is relatively stable at this point.

[Originium Complications]
Patient's race is predisposed to heavy sleep patterns that are largely reversed from those of other species. Patient's infection has interrupted the regularity of her sleep patterns.

An outstanding researcher, Silence is as meticulous as her peers. She has a keen eye for detail and single-minded execution. Once she begins an experiment, she runs through the process like a precision machine, flawlessly seeing it through to the end. Her rigorous approach to the scientific method has earned her great acclaim, with the staff under her just as commendable. 
But when it comes to interpersonal relationships, Silence is not so gifted, particularly when it comes to dealing with crowds. For example, when attending a party, she has a tendency to live up to her name. This is not to say she is universally introverted though. She draws energy from the serenity of intense concentration. That's simply led to her being more comfortable observing her surroundings in peaceful silence. 
She is known for her patience and eagerness to listen to fellow researchers. Silence is happy to discuss any scientific research questions from any and all angles. When someone encounters an obstacle in the scientific method, she will hear them out before providing a well thought out answer. Still, as busy as she is in the laboratory, most people don't get to see the communicative side of Silence, except those select few who participate in her research.

The valuable intelligence we have concerning Silence all comes from her contributions to the medical and life science fields. As a result, every piece of intelligence about her explores the company she used to work for - Rhine Lab. 
The specific time and duration of her tenure at Rhine Lab is unpublished. The current, most reliable information comes from Silence's own writings about her experiences as well as other aspects of her life. 
According to her recollection, Silence's relationship with Rhine Lab and Originium began during her days as a student, when she accompanied her mentor to the company. 
At that time, Rhine Lab was holding a scientific exhibition to show off the results of its research from a tour of Columbia. The new medical equipment she saw optimized Originium transmission efficiency based upon new results obtained from live trials, making possible a whole new generation of dazzling treatments. 
After completing her studies, Silence's wish came true and she was allowed to join Rhine Lab as an employee. She had an extraordinary talent for Originium Arts, and soon got the opportunity to participate in several experimental projects related to important Originium technology and clinical treatment. 
But as well as her career was going, and as much as the upper levels of the company recognized her achievements, Silence never forgot her original dream - to join the Originium Technology and Life Science Applications project. 

'I never thought the opportunity would come so soon.' 
Looking back on this time, Silence let slip a sly smile.

The medical drone designed by Silence and produced by the Rhodes Island Base Construction Department fully reflects Silence's philosophy as a doctor. 
The drone was designed to be unpretentious (as well as highly affordable). It was not fitted with a weapon, instead its only designated function was to provide timely treatment for Operators on the battlefield. 
Medicine that has undergone several rounds of testing by the Rhodes Island Pharmaceutical Team can be assembled into the drone's kits in a variety of ways. The drone can use aerosolized medicine, it can spray, it can inject, and it can simulate a medic's treatment wand. It can switch between these modes depending on the needs of the terrain and the environment, and the specific situation of the Operator in need of healing. 
However, this medical drone is still in its experimental stages. Because it needs to be lightweight and convenient, it needs to be a kind of throwaway and relatively fragile low-value target. Additionally, in areas with strong signal interference and complex terrain, its efficiency will be affected to a certain degree. 
Even so, it still provides Rhodes Island Operators with quality treatment. Better still, this is only the first gift that Silence has brought to Rhodes Island.

[Classified Log] 
'Let's pick up where we left off. Last time we talked about Rhine Lab's technological exhibition.' 
'Yes, you said that exhibition made a big impact on you.' 
'That's right. With regard to life, that exhibition gave me a whole bunch of new...' 
'Insights?' 
'Questions.' 
'...I don't understand.' 
'I wanted to know how life came about. How did it form in this land?' 
'Indeed, scholars have yet to produce a unified theory on this matter. But...what does this have to do with Originium?' 
'Why has Originium infected the human life on this continent?' 
'...I'm not sure.' 
'I'm not sure, either. That's why I couldn't wait to join Rhine Lab.' 
'Go on.' 
'I thought about it afterwards, and the one that shocked me the most was one of Rhine Lab's business exhibitions. 
After joining Rhine Lab, I realized that their best...rather, their most subversive product was still locked deep within the lab, resting on a proposal document. 
They couldn't bring it out yet, not for the people, not for the existing order, and not for this land. 
Perhaps it's still too soon. Yes, it's still too soon. 
But...once the right person comes along, a person with the right ideals...or, should I say, ambitions...' 
'Do you mean...?' 
'...... 
Heh heh....... 
All right. You already know too much.'

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

Cambrian 1097 Winter New Arrivals/Frosted Breath. Layered insulating design, free to be mixed and matched to individual taste. Catered to the client's personal needs, this fit has been altered by hand, adjusting the left sleeve's opening and adding an arm guard.

Pioneer Series/Lacquer. Raythean Industrial's new product is fully sealed and made with special fabrics that are resistant to even the harshest environmental conditions. Its dust-proof design is suitable for researchers who enter and exit dangerous areas.

modules.desc:
Operator Silence has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for healing teammates in the field.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Medic Operator during field operations to exercise Medic responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

'You want me to add a self-defense module to your medical drones?'
Outside the Lutra Workshop, Magallan stares wide-eyed at Silence, as if she's looking at a Seaborn flopping about in the middle of the great tundra.
'Um... would it be strange?'
'Not really, if you think about it—I just never imagined it, that's all. I figured you'd rather improve its healing efficacy, or maybe durability.'
'I probably would have thought along those lines in the past, yes.'
Magallan doesn't say anything. She may spend her days in the tundra year in and year out, but that doesn't mean she's completely clueless about Rhine Lab's internal affairs.
'I initially wanted nothing more than to be a researcher. I sought to thoroughly analyze the relationship between Originium and life, and I assumed I'd pry open the boundaries of knowledge with my own two hands.
'But following a string of incidents, I could no longer ignore this: as long as my research doesn't change course, I will never be able to completely exclude the 'human' perspective.
'Before I started a new job, I first needed to stand in the shoes of a doctor, from where I could examine my own dreams and ambitions. The most basic respect you can afford someone, as I see it.
'Those drones, then, are the crystallization of my ideology.'
The two inadvertently share a glance towards the workshop. Mayer is inside racking her brains; entering hastily was very liable to get you bitten.
'Speaking as a layman in medicine, I think these drones are already perfect as an extension of a doctor's hands.'
'Perhaps, but I've increasingly come to realize that merely serving as a doctor... is still not enough.'
Silence's expression is complicated. She lightly touches her hair.
'Humans are far more complex than Originium.
'We can roughly determine Originium activity from its surface appearance. We can predict the ETA of Catastrophes from natural phenomena. We can avoid infection through highly effective protective measures.
'But how do we determine a person's interior life from what's visible to us? Do falling figures signify deterioration or improvement? Are people with crossbows ultimately there to defend, or to kill?'
'Just like a snowfield that seems perfectly quiet,' Magallan murmurs to herself.
'Yes, just like a snowfield that seems perfectly quiet.
'Therefore, I need tougher measures, so that when the snowfield finally bares its fangs at me, I can protect the people I should be protecting.'

voice_lines.voiceText: Doctor, these are your tasks for the day. Yeah. A whole pile of work. Let's get to it.
Is Ifrit making trouble again? Sorry. I'll discipline her later.
Zzzzz… Sorry, I was taking a nap… I'm still not used to working during the day.
My reasons for quitting Rhine Lab? So much happened since I signed on, I don't even know where to start…
Have you ever heard of a woman named Saria? Like me, she was once a scientist at Rhine Lab, and she was one of the people responsible for the creation of Ifrit…
Our biology research at Rhine Lab went so far as to implant Originium Shards into living bodies… Sorry, we'd better change the subject.
Saria? You mean she's here at Rhodes Island too? Is she here for Ifrit…? After she walked out on us like that, why would she come here right now…?!
I will not allow Ifrit to see Saria. Please trust me, this is for Ifrit's own good…!

Are you trying to cure Oripathy too? I heard that you were involved in the development of medical technology at Rhodes Island. Heheh… you must be looking forward to a breakthrough, as a researcher yourself.
…Asleep already? All right. I'll handle the rest of the work.
I am Olivia Silence, an Originium scientist from the Rhine Lab Medical Research Institute. My hope is to rid the world of Oripathy… even if it means risking my life in the process.
I will make good use of this new power.
Is my medicine effective? Wonderful. This news brings me even greater joy than my promotion.
Doctor, I am looking forward to the day when the world is finally cured of Oripathy. In fighting and studying with you, I think that day may not be far off.
Understood. I'll focus on support.
Come on, team, let's fight with all our might.
Originium… Are you to blame for this battle?
Observe and determine the form of Infection. Such data will be useful for research.
Doctor, let me do it.
No abnormality detected.
Concentrate.
Stay calm.
I'll heal you.
No need to panic.
Deploying.
Support incoming.
In order to defeat stronger enemies, must we make further use of Originium's power…?
Medical team, please take tissue samples from the Infected, we need to see the composition of the Infection in this area.
All wounded personnel, please remain calm. The medical team will get to you.
…Now is not the time for despair. We must withdraw immediately.
This room… Ugh… It's like it's designed to make me sleepy!
Hmm?
Doctor, you're kinder these days.
Arknights.

Have you seen Ifrit, Doctor? They're shooting off fireworks outside, so I'm a little worried… Yes, I'm going back to the lab after I put her to bed. No, I haven't forgotten what day it is. This is just how I want to welcome the new year. Oh right, happy New Year.
Good day, Doctor.
Doctor, I have a proposal for your review: a new medical drone model. Oh, and I've heard it's your birthday. I didn't mean it like this, but hopefully you find it a practical gift.

There's no lack of ambition and idealism in the field of life sciences… I myself was drawn by those ideals before I found my true calling. But thanks to Rhodes Island, I now know what I'm researching and fighting for.

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to a Factory, productivity <@cc.vup>+15%</>
